page.title: 01THE VILLAGE OF HENFIELD.
page.content: The village of Henfield lies on a low greensand ridge.It does not rise more than 150feet above sea-level.It is a fertile ridge with plenty of springs but the area is well drained. The sandy soil makes it a good area for growing so there are farms and market gardens.There are some lovely views of the South Downs. The village is constantly growing. New residential areas blend with the older historic houses. There is a Primary School, library, Health Centre and a Dentist.There are several places of worship, a historic C.of E. Church, a modern R.C. Church, a Free Evangelical Church and a Rehobath Baptist Chapel. There are plenty of Clubs and Societies to join for both adults and children. The area is administered by the Henfield Parish Council.
